text: Roshkodom () is a sweet popular in Bangladesh and East India. It consists of a small ball of Rasgulla (another type of Indian dessert, which is harder than the normal ones in this recipe) covered in a layer of khoya/mava (solidified dried milk) which is further covered on the outer surface by poppy seeds. . It is also known as Raskadam. The main ingredients are khoa, chana and poppy seeds. It is also known as "Khoya kodom" or "Kheer kodom". ==References== Category:Jharkhandi cuisine Category:Bangladeshi desserts Category:Bengali desserts
title: Roshkodom
